stream_context.summary: Kaze focused almost the entire session on blocking out a new "arts-and-crafts / cardboard" sub-area inside the larger cardboard course.  He experimented with platform sizes, colours, and fall-timers, discussed adding saw blades that activate on proximity, and debated floor textures.  Brief detours covered emulator issues, texture clarity ideas, and future demo/speedrun plans.
level: planned cameo: delfino plaza (hidden in course-1 demo)

development_findings.summary: The sub-area is built around coloured cardboard platforms that drop when Mario nears them, with saw blades placed between platforms that start moving once the player is close, turning the stage into a race rather than an autoscroller.
development_findings.quote: So the idea is I have these two platform designs ... there's going to be saws between the platforms and when you get close enough to a saw, the saw starts going.  You do have to constantly move pretty fast to not die in this level.

development_findings.summary: Kaze uses a custom "BBeRms" property on actors to rescale identical platform meshes at load-time, giving quick size variety without duplicating assets.
development_findings.quote: I have BBeRms on the actor and I can change the BBeRms to change the scale of the platforms.  I did that to allow for more variety here.

development_findings.summary: He considered halving the hat texture size only on emulator builds to reduce blurriness, implemented a quick toggle, but rejected it for looking "stupid" and for avoiding excess options.
development_findings.quote: I programmed it so that on emulator it shows like this and on N64 it shows like this ... I think it looks like shit by the way, so I'm not adding this.

development_findings.summary: Floor texture remains unsolved; current repeated pattern looks bad.  He may dynamically generate vertices and UVs or switch to a painted motif.
development_findings.quote: Obviously what we have right now is awful ... might actually be what I have to do then.

development_findings.summary: Speed-run ballpark: any% estimated 80–85 min, 100% roughly 3–3.5 hours, assuming no major skips.
development_findings.quote: Realistically ... any% speedruns ... are probably going to be around 80–85 minutes.

development_findings.summary: Course-1 public demo is still planned and will secretly contain an N64 rendition of Delfino Plaza, hidden behind an unlock condition.
development_findings.quote: I'm probably also gonna just randomly throw in Delfino Plaza on the N64 into the demo ... I'm gonna hide that really well in the demo.

development_findings.summary: He routinely tests on both real N64 and emulators; found underflow/clamping warnings likely specific to the emulator and lots of occlusion-plane errors in Fast64 but is currently ignoring them.
Expressed long-term interest in an open-world Mario 64 hack but doubts he’ll have the time.
development_findings.quote: I would like to do an open-world Mario 64 at some point but whether I'll have time to do that is a completely separate issue.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s primary professional priorities are finishing the game and earning income; YouTube videos are a monetization tool, not a passion.
context_findings.quote: There’s two things I care about in life right now.  The first is making my video game and the second is making money.  Making YouTube videos, for me, that’s just a way to make money.

context_findings.summary: He believes fewer user options make better design and avoids adding toggles for every aesthetic complaint.
context_findings.quote: Because I'm not adding options for every little baby thing.  Less options is better, don't you ask me.

context_findings.summary: Shows frustration with Parallel Launcher (ParaLLEl core) due to controller and graphics bugs, calling it "garbage" despite community pressure to adopt it.
context_findings.quote: What a garbage-ass I'm gonna play ... everyone's telling me to use this, and it's just... I hate it.

context_findings.summary: Brief personal note: Zeina wakes up slowly; Kaze often begins work before breakfast while waiting for her, hinting at their daily routine.
context_findings.quote: Zeina takes so long out of bed that after we get up, I go down and I start working and then we eat because she's out of bed now.

context_findings.summary: Takes pride in difficult movement but wants platforming to stay fair for average players; repeatedly tests sections himself to find balance.

biobak.summary: Chat acknowledged a "Biobak fan" but no direct contribution this stream.

zeina.summary: Mentioned in personal context (slow to get up in the morning) but no project work cited this session.

key_stories.title: Rejected Hat-Texture Fix
key_stories.summary: Players said Mario’s cap looked blurry on emulator.  Kaze coded a conditional replacement that halves the hat texture size only in emulator builds.  After testing, he felt it looked silly and would clutter settings, so he scrapped the idea.
key_stories.challenge: Improve texture crispness on emulator without harming N64 visuals.
key_stories.process: Implemented build-specific texture swap and live-tested on stream.
key_stories.outcome: Feature abandoned; kept original texture for all platforms.
key_stories.key_quote: I think it looks like shit by the way, so I'm not adding this.

key_stories.title: Building the Cardboard Race
key_stories.summary: Kaze designed a sub-area of coloured cardboard platforms that fall while saws chase the player.  He iteratively adjusted platform spacing, scaling via BBeRms, and tested difficulty until satisfied.
key_stories.challenge: Create a fresh platforming concept that feels tense but fair.
key_stories.process: Blocked out geometry in Blender, used actor scaling, repeatedly play-tested, narrowed gaps, and planned saw logic.
key_stories.outcome: Layout approved; next steps are adding saw AI and final texture work.
key_stories.key_quote: This is the plan ... it's not really an autoscroller, it's more like a race.

key_stories.title: Parallel Launcher Frustrations
key_stories.summary: Community recommends Parallel Launcher, but on stream Kaze demonstrated broken inputs and missing coin rendering, declaring it unusable for him and sparking a brief rant on emulator reliability.
key_stories.challenge: Find a stable emulator workflow for testing.
key_stories.process: Live-swap between ParaLLEl and Mupen, showing bugs.
key_stories.outcome: Sticks with existing setup; notes ParaLLEl still buggy.
key_stories.key_quote: I just showed you that it has bugs live on stream.  This is not a matter of you agreeing or disagreeing.
